title._content: Part of the plumbing and associated equipment for the solar heating and coiling demonstration project..., 05/1975.

description._content: Original Caption: Part of the plumbing and associated equipment for the solar heating and coiling demonstration project at Colorado state university at fort collins, funded by the National Science Foundation. Flat plate collectors on the roof of the demonstration home have blackened copper tubing to absorb heat from the sun. It is a liquid as opposed to a hot air system. The heated water is piped through the house to heat it. There are several drawbacks to the system which is not yet on the market. Corrosion is a problem, the roof needs reinforcing and anti-freeze is required, 05/1975. U.S. National Archives’ Local Identifier: 412-DA-14864 Photographer: Norton, Boyd Subjects: Environmental protection Natural resources Pollution Fort Collins (Colorado, United States) inhabited place Persistent URL: research.archives.gov/description/557316 Repository: Still Picture Records Section, Special Media Archives Services Division (NWCS-S), National Archives at College Park, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD, 20740-6001.
